TopicTitle: Show off your awesome KSP pictures!

Articles.Content:
STOCK Heavy Missile launcher. Range 45 km. Drives REALLY well. Armor so thick it can bounce a rocket the size of (^the one Nannermancan^) posted going 200m/s!

And yes ordinance is fully controllable. Have fun and remember to always fire downrange!

http://www./?bg6aphc2dba2hlh

That is the best thing I have ever seen!

I know (I should put it on Spaceport)

Gif time!

It's funny how often KSP landings are successful, with the qualifier "rescue mission to follow."

Practically everything in my space program carries that qualifier. Or the ever cheerful visit to the next of kin ... all of whom have the same last name. At least that bit is easy to remember

Munfrid was not very satisfied with his current situation on the Mun,so he ordered a rover.

Not the most pin-point landing,but with only 841m distance to the fledgling colony,it was still satisfying.

Now Munfrid can travel in style,instead of walking all day,

This thing carries no engines at all. No fuel. Just by flapping of the control surfaces, this thing can reach over 700 m/s at 1000 m.

And the landspeed record achieved? Possibly G force record achieved?

And one of those flying saucers on the Mun! (part flew off of my lander in such a fashion it looked like a flying saucer, flew into orbit around the mun, pretty neat!)

hey guys i have a question for you...

1. how do i upload a ship file to kerbal spaceport if i already have an account

2. does it matter what mods i have as long as the craft i am uploading is completely stock parts

3. anything i really should know about uploading ships to the spaceport.

-Snip-

Oh no, what have you started...

hey guys i have a question for you...

1. how do i upload a ship file to kerbal spaceport if i already have an account

2. does it matter what mods i have as long as the craft i am uploading is completely stock parts

3. anything i really should know about uploading ships to the spaceport.

1: There should be a submit an addon link somewhere in your profile, IIRC.

2: Certainly not, as long as if you claim a 100% stock craft that it has 100% stock parts. One part out of whack and it won't be loaded. You can certainly submit other modded craft, but it's good etiquette to let others know what mods the craft uses.

3: It takes a while after you actually upload for it to show up. But yeah no, nothing really, just try to make sure your stuff is complete, which I need to review my addons at some point.

Oh no, what have you started...

this is why i let jeb help design my rockets.

these are step by step photos of my vtol, it uses stock parts and parts from the 'damned robotics mod' . it is reasonably stable becuase of an avionics package i mounted behind it. its called the Aeris 3C becuase it is a heavily modified Aeris 3A.
My first SSTO spaceplane that actually reached stable orbit and later luckily (I kinda messed up the RCS) docked to my space station on 150km orbit with plenty of fuel left.
